p: Children under the age of 5 years (“young”) and especially under 2 years (“very young”) are high risk for influenza complications simply because of their age, even if otherwise healthy. [ 1, 2] They have increased risk of influenza-related hospitalizations, and doctor, urgent care, and emergency department visits, [ 3, 4] comprising a substantial portion of total US influenza morbidity. [ 5] Influenza in children also affects family members and caregivers, [ 6] causing substantial parental work absenteeism, [ 7] and community epidemics. [ 8]
